## Impacts

- Most of Wisconsin has warmed about two degrees (F).

- Heavy rainstorms are becoming more frequent.

-Ice cover on the Great Lakes is forming later or melting
sooner. 

- In the coming decades, the state will have more extremely hot days, which may harm public healt
    
[EPA Snapshot](https://19january2017snapshot.epa.gov/sites/production/files/2016-09/documents/climate-change-ws.pdf)

## State Adaptation / Mitigation Plans

- Wisconsin has not adopted an official statewide adaptation plan, however, the state has undertaken other efforts to assess climate vulnerabilities and identify adaptation strategies

- Wisconsin Governor's Task Force on Climate Change Report, December 2020

- State of Wisconsin Hazard Mitigation Plan	Emergency December 2016 (amended January 2017)
